issue.title: The pyarrow installation is not built with support for 'HadoopFileSystem'
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-11555](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11555). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
When running:
```java

import pyarrow as pa

pa.fs.HadoopFileSystem("node-master", port=54310)
```
I get the following error:
```java

ImportError: The pyarrow installation is not built with support for 'HadoopFileSystem'
```
Installed on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and via:
```java

conda install -c conda-forge "pyarrow=3.0.0"
```
But when I run the following command, I am able to connect to my HDFS cluster:
```java

hdfs = pa.hdfs.connect('node-master', port=54310)
```

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11555?focusedCommentId=17281020) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Can you please post the output of `conda list` of your environment?

We explicitly check for this support in https://github.com/conda-forge/arrow-cpp-feedstock/blob/0aa7d9e91df13451efa5d500e9dc500e786222ff/recipe/meta.yaml#L218 and thus shouldn't be missing.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11555?focusedCommentId=17281037) by Nikolai Janakiev (njanakiev):*

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11555?focusedCommentId=17281076) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
This has `arrow-cpp` from defaults, this is missing HDFS support. You have a lot packages from defaults, I suggest to recreate the environment with solely using `conda-forge` as the package source. The `arrow-cpp` / `pyarrow` packages are currently in a broken state.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11555?focusedCommentId=17281089) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Closing this here as this is an Anaconda issue which is tracked over at https://github.com/AnacondaRecipes/pyarrow-feedstock/issues/2

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11555?focusedCommentId=17585936) by @toddfarmer:*
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
